course_description: This course is intended to give students an idea of the work conducted by investment banks.  Areas reviewed will include debt financing, equity underwriting, merger & acquisition advisory assignments, and trading activity. Special emphasis will be placed on the methods commonly applied when conducting valuation, debt capacity, and transaction analysis.  In addition, to provide context, there will be a brief summary of investment banking history and of the peripheral players (private equity and hedge funds) that interact with banks.
